content.description: In chloroplasts, <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is synthesized from <math alttext="A D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ADP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> plus inorganic phosphate <math alttext="P sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>i</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in a reaction catalyzed by <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> synthase molecules that are embedded in the thylakoid membrane.
content.question: Which of the following statements provides evidence to support the claim that no <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be synthesized in the absence of a proton gradient across the thylakoid membrane?

choices.label: Blocking electron flow from one carrier to the next in the electron transport chains blocks formation of a proton gradient in the thylakoid.

Increasing the proton concentration difference across the thylakoid membrane is not associated with a parallel increase in the rate of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> synthesis.

No <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is synthesized when channel proteins that allow the free passage of protons are inserted into the thylakoid membrane.

No <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is synthesized while the Calvin cycle is synthesizing carbohydrates and using <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N A D P H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADPH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at a high rate.

content.answer: No <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is synthesized when channel proteins that allow the free passage of protons are inserted into the thylakoid membrane.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
